articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: More than 100 Palestinians were killed and dozens wounded in an Israeli strike on a Gaza school sheltering displaced people, the official Palestinian news agency said on Saturday, while the Israeli army said it had hit a Hamas command centre.
articles.title: Israel strike on Gaza school kills more than 100, Palestinian news agency says

articles.author: Guy Faulconbridge
articles.description: Russia was fighting intense battles on Saturday against thousands of Ukrainian troops as deep as 20 km (12 miles) inside the Kursk region after Ukraine's biggest attack on Russian sovereign territory since the start of the war in 2022.
articles.title: Russia fighting intense battles against major Ukrainian incursion

articles.author: Shoon Naing, Poppy Mcpherson, Devjyot Ghoshal
articles.description: A drone attack on Rohingya fleeing Myanmar killed many dozens of people, including families with children, several witnesses said, describing survivors wandering between piles of bodies to identify dead and injured relatives.
articles.title: Many dozens of Rohingya, including children, killed in drone attack while fleeing Myanmar, witnesses say

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Bangladesh's chief justice and central bank governor have resigned, officials said on Saturday, as student protests that forced Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina to flee widen to target more officials appointed during her regime.
articles.title: Bangladesh chief justice, central bank chief quit amid protests, officials say

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Philippine military said on Saturday it strongly condemns "dangerous and provocative actions" by China's air force at a contested shoal in the South China Sea.
articles.title: Philippine military condemns China air force for 'dangerous' acts in South China Sea

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A man convicted in the killing of Russian opposition politician Boris Nemtsov has been discharged from jail after signing a contract to join the military operation in Ukraine, state-run news agencies TASS and RIA Novosti reported on Saturday.
articles.title: Convict in Kremlin critic murder released from jail to fight in Ukraine - agencies

articles.author: Umaru Fofana
articles.description: A military court in Sierra Leone has sentenced 24 soldiers to lengthy prison terms for their roles in a failed attempt to overthrow the government of President Julius Maada Bio last November.
articles.title: Sierra Leone court sentences soldiers to long jail terms for failed coup

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A plane with 62 people on board crashed in Vinhedo, Brazil, on Friday, local TV station GloboNews reported.
articles.title: Plane crashes in Brazil with 62 people on board, local media reports

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Iran's newly elected president has reinstated Mohammad Eslami as head of the country's Atomic Energy Organisation, state media reported on Saturday.
articles.title: New president reinstates Eslami as head of Iran's Atomic Energy Organisation, state media says
Harris campaigns in Arizona, while Trump is in Montana
